results.title: Jean Mitry Compilation
results.brief_description: En Bateau A visual interpretation of 3 piano compositions by Claude Debussy, “En Bateau”, “Movements” and “Clouchies a Travers Les Feuilles”. “Images Pour Debussy” Scenes of rivers, streams, waves, fields are used in this visual interpretation of four Debussy works: “En Bateau”, “Reflets Dans L’Eau” and “Arabesques”. “Pacific 231” Arthur Honnegar’s visual interpretation of a symphonic poem. “Reverie De Claude Debussy” Four piano works by Debussy: “Movements”, “Cloches a Travers Les Feuilles”, “Reverie” and “Claire de Lune”.
results.description: En Bateau A visual interpretation of 3 piano compositions by Claude Debussy, “En Bateau”, “Movements” and “Clouchies a Travers Les Feuilles”. “Images Pour Debussy” Scenes of rivers, streams, waves, fields are used in this visual interpretation of four Debussy works: “En Bateau”, “Reflets Dans L’Eau” and “Arabesques”. “Pacific 231” Arthur Honnegar’s visual interpretation of a symphonic poem. “Reverie De Claude Debussy” Four piano works by Debussy: “Movements”, “Cloches a Travers Les Feuilles”, “Reverie” and “Claire de Lune”.
description_for_label: En Bateau A visual interpretation of 3 piano compositions by Claude Debussy, “En Bateau”, “Movements” and “Clouchies a Travers Les Feuilles”. “Images Pour Debussy” Scenes of rivers, streams, waves, fields are used in this visual interpretation of four Debussy works: “En Bateau”, “Reflets Dans L’Eau” and “Arabesques”. “Pacific 231” Arthur Honnegar’s visual interpretation of a symphonic poem. “Reverie De Claude Debussy” Four piano works by Debussy: “Movements”, “Cloches a Travers Les Feuilles”, “Reverie” and “Claire de Lune”.

results.title: Jean's fugue
results.creator_credit: Michael Reeves, Derek Wright and New Zealand National Film Unit
results.brief_description: Shows the activities at a Summer Music School at Cambridge. The intensive work and casual fun make the fortnight at Cambridge University benefit both the individual musician and the music world.

results.title: Jealousy = Pebhoot
results.creator_credit: Todor Dinov and State Distribution Centre
results.brief_description: Animation using musical notation whereby the stave represents the ground and groups of notes have the appearance of horses and riders, after the style of the traditional western. Includes a sequence when a treble clef is seized for use as a lassoo.

results.title: Jealousy
results.brief_description: An absorbing program, hosted by psychologists Peter Quarry, in which people talk about their jealousy - how they felt, what they did and why. A private investigator, police and psychologists discuss how jealousy can lead to violence and present strategies for coping with it.

results.title: Jazzoo [Short version]
results.brief_description: Illustrates the beauty, colour and activities of a zoo in the early hours of a summer morning. This film illustrates how the filmmaker uses his basic resource - the visual image - without the use of words.

results.title: Jazz mania
results.creator_credit: Chris Hubbard and Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School
results.brief_description: This production takes a look at the impact of Jazz on people and society when it was firstly introduced in the 1920’s. Incorporating archival footage with dramatised scenes resembling newsreels of the time, the film documents the shock and consternation registered by polite society.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Chris Hubbard and Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School

results.title: Jazz in the concert hall. Parts 1 and 2
results.creator_credit: Roger Englander and Columbia Broadcasting System
results.brief_description: Leonard Bernstein explains and illustrates the nature of jazz and its fusion with serious concert music since the 1920’s. Includes three major works performed by the New York Philharmonic Orchestra and soloists to illustrate this fusion: Gunther Schuller’s “Journey into jazz” featuring jazz musicians Don Ellis (Itrumpet), Eric Dolphy (alto sax), Benny Golsen (tenor sax), Richard Davis (bass) and Joseph Cocuzzo (drums); Aaron Copland’s “Concerto for piano and orchestra”; Larry Austin’s “Improvisations for orchestra and jazz soloists”.
results.title_for_label: Jazz in the concert hall. Parts 1 and 2
results.description: Leonard Bernstein explains and illustrates the nature of jazz and its fusion with serious concert music since the 1920’s. Includes three major works performed by the New York Philharmonic Orchestra and soloists to illustrate this fusion: Gunther Schuller’s “Journey into jazz” featuring jazz musicians Don Ellis (Itrumpet), Eric Dolphy (alto sax), Benny Golsen (tenor sax), Richard Davis (bass) and Joseph Cocuzzo (drums); Aaron Copland’s “Concerto for piano and orchestra”; Larry Austin’s “Improvisations for orchestra and jazz soloists”.
